column2: ITP016 - AGL Removal of Luminaires and Install of foundations
column8: ITP016 - AGL Removal of Luminaires and Install of foundations

column2: Frequency: Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are using the latest and complete set of drawings
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Frequency: Prior to commencing any activities
Acceptance Criteria: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP.
Reference Documents: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity: Site and Office Inspection
Acceptance Criteria: All materials shall be proven to meet contractual requirements prior to acceptance.
Reference Documents: Appendix K- AGL Specification Section 2.3.3
Record of conformity: Datasheet/ Material Submission
Frequency: Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria: Surveyor to pick up existing location of all AGL Luminaires and position of foundations are prescribed based on design RL.
Record of conformity: Survey as Built
2.0 Removal of AGL Luminaires and installation of Foundation (All light types)
Acceptance Criteria: Ensure that the light to be removed corresponds to project drawings and documentation.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed & AGL Sub-Contractor ITC
Acceptance Criteria: Prior to commencement of removal, the subcontractor shall ensure that the light has been isolated from power.
Reference Documents: APAM Electrical Isolation Standards
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed & AGL Sub-Contractor ITC
Acceptance Criteria: Remove existing light and AGL cables from conduits as per Sub-Contractor ITC for the Method 1- 8 lights.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed & AGL Sub-Contractor ITC
Acceptance Criteria: After removal of the light, the subcontractor must ensure that the light number and position is recorded and stored accordingly for re-installation.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed & AGL Sub-Contractor ITC
• Core pavement to required depth as per subcontractor ITC for relevant Method. Remove base and clean void.
• Existing AGL secondary cables removed after coring.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed & AGL Subcontractor ITC
1) Position bung/spacer in 150mm diameter hole of foundation. Ensure cables and conduits are clear and clean.
2) Apply Nitrobond to face of existing foundation.
3) Mix and position quick set concrete onto the top of the existing foundation and let cure.

1) Conduits repaired after coring of light base to subgrade level. Where 2 conduits are parallel with limited spacing for exterior coupling, a stainless steel sleeve inside the conduits is to be placed, this will be glued into each end. - The thickness of the stainless steel sleeve is 1.6mm ensuring. A Coupling is then used to connect the conduits on either side of the foundation void.
2) Mix and position quick set concrete onto the top of subgrade and let cure.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed & AGL Sub-Contractor ITC
Acceptance Criteria: As required, luminaire fittings to be safeguarded to allow for placement of asphalt with a Blanking plate.
Record of conformity: This Signed ITP & AGL Sub-Contractor ITC
• Place hotmix asphalt in void above new foundation and compact using hand tools.
• Ensure asphalt is finished flush with surrounding surface.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed & AGL Sub-Contractor ITC
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
